dcterms:creator: A. J. McNeil
R. Frey
P. Embrechts
dcterms:description: Value-at-Risk (VaR) is a risk measure that estimates the maximum potential loss over a specified time period at a given confidence level.
dcterms:title: VaR (Value-at-Risk)

dcterms:creator: A. J. McNeil
R. Frey
P. Embrechts
dcterms:description: Expected Shortfall (ES) is a risk measure that calculates the average loss given that a loss exceeds the Value-at-Risk (VaR) threshold.
dcterms:title: ES (Expected Shortfall)

dcterms:creator: A. J. McNeil
R. Frey
P. Embrechts
dcterms:description: Discrete Portfolio Loss Random Variable represents the losses of a portfolio where the outcomes are discrete random variables.
dcterms:title: Discrete Portfolio Loss Random Variable

dcterms:creator: A. J. McNeil
R. Frey
P. Embrechts
dcterms:description: Continuous Portfolio Loss Random Variable represents the losses of a portfolio where the outcomes are continuous random variables.
dcterms:title: Continuous Portfolio Loss Random Variable

dcterms:creator: A. J. McNeil
R. Frey
P. Embrechts
dcterms:description: Heavy-Tailed Portfolio Loss Random Variable refers to portfolio losses that exhibit heavy-tailed behavior, indicating a higher likelihood of extreme losses.
dcterms:title: Heavy-Tailed Portfolio Loss Random Variable

dcterms:creator: P. Glasserman
dcterms:description: Credit Portfolio represents a collection of credit exposures and their associated risks, used for measuring marginal risk contributions.
dcterms:title: Credit Portfolio

dcterms:creator: A. J. McNeil
R. Frey
P. Embrechts
dcterms:description: Generalized Pareto Distribution is a statistical distribution used to model the tails of another distribution, particularly in risk management.
dcterms:title: Generalized Pareto Distribution

dcterms:creator: A. J. McNeil
R. Frey
P. Embrechts
dcterms:description: Student t Distribution is a probability distribution used in statistics that is particularly useful for modeling data with heavy tails.
dcterms:title: Student t Distribution
